title: Need help identifying this font (like ITC Ronda)
author: Tobias75

comments.content:
If the |A| is what make you think it's not Ronda, depending on the age of the sample, it could well be a non digitised alternate glyph.

Edit: confirmed here: [http://fontsinuse.com/uses/8676/official-california-visitor-map](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095532/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/8676/official-california-visitor-map "http://fontsinuse.com/uses/8676/official-california-visitor-map")  
It looks that, like many 1970s' typefaces, there were plenty of variations that never made it to digital: [http://fontsinuse.com/typefaces/10234/itc-ronda](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095532/http:/fontsinuse.com/typefaces/10234/itc-ronda "http://fontsinuse.com/typefaces/10234/itc-ronda")

Confirming Ronda too. Mike Yenaga's ["Bauhaus-Style" Font Identification Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095532/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/BauhausFaces1.html) showcases this top rounded alternate /A on ' [Ronda Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095532/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Fonts/FontScans/RondaLt.gif)'.

The Ronda Light with Rounded Alternate doesn’t exist in digital version? No?  
(Sorry for my bad english)

Don't know any official version of Ronda ITC that comes with this alternate /A, not even the [Pro version](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415095532/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/ronda/pro/glyphs.html). If you need to reproduce it exactly, I guess the only option you have is to recreate it (and from /U, should be quite easy).
